wikipedia_page.main: Harold Philip Miles (31 January 1899 – 21 July 1957) was an Argentinian-born English cricketer and British Army officer.  Miles was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm off break.  He was the elder son of Harold Miles of Odstock, Instow, Devon but was born in Rosario, Santa Fe. He moved to England at some point in his early life, where he was educated at Shrewsbury School, representing the school cricket team. In 1929 he married Miss Ada Margaret Paton, only daughter of Mr. James Paton, J.P., and Mrs. Paton of Newton Cross, Devon.
